content:
Here are some points on what happened this week in aftercare from our HR manager:
Client: C2
Developer: Cyril Lonsido 
Cy was asking if it’s possible to be transferred to another client. no concerns on tasks but more on the work environment. He is trying to work through it since he knows he is the only resource there now since En has left but sometimes it tends to get tedious since he feels like Viktor is still not listening and forcing his unconventional approach with the project. Cy assured us he will still hang on but would like to check if ever if there are opportunity for him to be transferred in case the work environment get more toxic.

Suggestions:
Action items:

Client: BlueFrog
Developer: Paul Gravos 

Paul mentioned he is getting some back end tasks ever since Jasper has left. he does not mind but also like to further prepare himself on this by taking in proper training/workshop. he is also inquiring if BlueFrog will find a replacement for Jasper as it will help especially on the back end part of the project.

Suggestions:
Action items:

Client: Pastest
Developer: John Gela - he will be working on a new project involving Angular. although he has basic knowledge the project will be quite complicated so he is inquiring if he could do formal training/workshop.

Suggestions:
Action items:
Client: Knights Absorb
Developer: Joshua Osillo
he shared that he is working closely with Elly and some with Greg for the mobile development team. So far he is getting the hang of using Figma and have started working on the basic features of it. He is focusing now on the booking application and have completely turned over the mobile projects to Greg since he is aware and also mentioned this to Steve that this is not his forte.

Suggestions:
Action items:

Client: Bluebay
Developer: Albert Gaya 
equipment request to upgrade his laptop storage.

Suggestions:
Action items:

Client: Evoke
Developer: Jonel Catapang
extension for Part time. he mentioned he will get back to us next week on this one. he just need to check how is his current tasks as does not want to commit as well and not able to deliver.

Suggestions:
Action items:
Client: Redbox
Developer: Jaerome 
 something to just take note of but not a red flag. Jaerome mentioned that he is working on design part of the project since there current designer have resigned. although he knows the basics and able to deliver and its up to modern design he feels like this is not enough though on a designer perspective in which he is struggling a bit. he has advised client on this and Jaerome mentioned they understand this as well but just like to keep us updated on this as well.

Suggestions:
Action items:
—-

Can you please give suggestions and action items on the above client/developers. Just write it out as you see it above and fill in the suggestions and action items for each issue stated. Remember we really want to provide our developers with Upskill programs to encourage their career growth and help them in their existing jobs, also we want to give them perks and help them with their health and wellness, so that they work better. We also supply equipment for all of our developers also. Please also space it out so that is readable and dont mention arni, you need to act as a system that is stating suggestions and action items for each client/developer relationship
